value: Arcane

Inherited arcane weapons cannot be
equipped with most Hero-exclusive
skills, though there are exceptions.

Once it has been inherited, an arcane weapon
cannot be re-inherited by another Hero.

Since the source ally is a Rearmed
Hero, they will not be lost, but you
will no longer be able to use them
as a source ally when inheriting skills
or when creating Combat Manuals.

Once it has been inherited, an arcane
weapon cannot be re-inherited, and
also cannot be equipped with most
Hero-exclusive skills, with exceptions.

When merging two Rearmed Heroes, the target
will not gain an additional arcane inheritance.
Archive of the North
Flavors of Fall

The forest delivers its seasonal treats!
What bounty might await them?

They lost their precious grapes!
The lesson? Beware hungry birds!

They foraged a mushroom mountain!
A feast of mushrooms awaits them!

They gathered a huge fall bounty!
Gratitude for the forest was tangible!
The Path's End

Rearmed Heroes:
Rearmed Heroes can use a
special type of skill inheritance
that differs from the inheritance
used by Heroes under typical
circumstances.

Arcane Inheritance:
In contrast with inheritance as it
usually occurs, when performing
arcane inheritance, the source ally
will not be lost (once for each
summon of a Rearmed Hero, and
the Rearmed Hero cannot create
Combat Manuals afterward).

Arcane Weapon Skills:
・ Arcane weapons are inheritable.
・ Once an arcane weapon is
inherited, it loses its ability to be
inherited via Inherit Skill.

Arcane Weapon Restrictions:
Only Rearmed Heroes can equip
both their arcane weapon and
an exclusive skill (such as Gray
Waves, etc.) other than Sing,
Dance, or Play at the same time.

Ascended Heroes - Ascended Traits:
Ascended Heroes have an Ascended Asset,
which boosts one of their stats beyond that
Hero's standard asset and flaw.
Ascendant Florets can also be used to grant
Ascended Assets to non-Ascended Heroes.
(See the Ascend Traits menu Help messages
to learn more.)

Rearmed Heroes - Pre-Inheritance:
In contrast with standard inheritance,
arcane weapon skills can be inherited
and the source ally will not be lost in
the process. This can be performed
only once for each Rearmed Hero
summoned. (See the Inherit Skills
menu Help messages to learn more.)

Rearmed Heroes - Arcane Inheritance:
In contrast with standard inheritance,
arcane weapon skills can be inherited
and the source ally will not be lost in
the process. This can be performed
only once for each Rearmed Hero
summoned. (See the Inherit Skills
menu Help messages to learn more.)
